Structs/MatchMoreConfig.html.name: MatchMoreConfig
Structs/MatchMoreConfig.html.abstract: MatchMoreConfig is a structure that defines all variables needed to configure MatchMore SDK.

Enums/Result.html.name: Result
Enums/Result.html.abstract: Result represents async response from the server. It can be either success or failure using internal enum values to represent response data.

Enums/DeviceType.html.name: DeviceType
Enums/DeviceType.html.abstract: A device might be either virtual like a pin device or physical like a mobile phone or iBeacon device.

Classes/RequestBuilder.html#/s:9Matchmor.name: onProgressReady
Classes/RequestBuilder.html#/s:9Matchmor.abstract: Optional block to obtain a reference to the request’s progress instance when available.

Classes/PublicationAPI.html#/s:9Matchmor.name: getPublication(deviceId:publicationId:completion:)
Classes/PublicationAPI.html#/s:9Matchmor.abstract: Info about a publication on a device

Classes/PublicationAPI.html#/s:9Matchmor.name: getPublicationWithRequestBuilder(deviceId:publicationId:)
Classes/PublicationAPI.html#/s:9Matchmor.abstract: Info about a publication on a device

Classes/AlamofireRequestBuilder.html#/s:.name: createSessionManager()
Classes/AlamofireRequestBuilder.html#/s:.abstract: May be overridden by a subclass if you want to control the session

Classes/AlamofireRequestBuilder.html#/s:.name: contentTypeForFormPart(fileURL:)
Classes/AlamofireRequestBuilder.html#/s:.abstract: May be overridden by a subclass if you want to control the Content-Type

Classes/AlamofireRequestBuilder.html#/s:.name: makeRequest(manager:method:encoding:headers:)
Classes/AlamofireRequestBuilder.html#/s:.abstract: May be overridden by a subclass if you want to control the request

Classes/LocationAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore11.name: createLocation(deviceId:location:completion:)
Classes/LocationAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore11.abstract: Create a new location for a device

Classes/LocationAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore11.name: createLocationWithRequestBuilder(deviceId:location:)
Classes/LocationAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore11.abstract: Create a new location for a device

Classes/SubscriptionAPI.html#/s:9Matchmo.name: getSubscription(deviceId:subscriptionId:completion:)
Classes/SubscriptionAPI.html#/s:9Matchmo.abstract: Info about a subscription on a device

Classes/SubscriptionAPI.html#/s:9Matchmo.name: getSubscriptionWithRequestBuilder(deviceId:subscriptionId:)
Classes/SubscriptionAPI.html#/s:9Matchmo.abstract: Info about a subscription on a device

Classes/MobileDevice.html#/s:9Matchmore1.name: platform
Classes/MobileDevice.html#/s:9Matchmore1.abstract: The platform of the device, this can be any string representing the platform type, for instance ‘iOS’.

Classes/MobileDevice.html#/s:9Matchmore1.name: deviceToken
Classes/MobileDevice.html#/s:9Matchmore1.abstract: The deviceToken is the device push notification token given to this device by the OS, either iOS or Android for identifying the device with push notification services.

Classes/IBeaconTriple.html#/s:9Matchmore.name: proximityUUID
Classes/IBeaconTriple.html#/s:9Matchmore.abstract: The UUID of the beacon, the purpose is to distinguish iBeacons in your network, from all other beacons in networks outside your control.

Classes/IBeaconTriple.html#/s:9Matchmore.name: major
Classes/IBeaconTriple.html#/s:9Matchmore.abstract: Major values are intended to identify and distinguish a group.

Classes/IBeaconTriple.html#/s:9Matchmore.name: minor
Classes/IBeaconTriple.html#/s:9Matchmore.abstract: Minor values are intended to identify and distinguish an individual.

Classes/IBeaconDevice.html#/s:9Matchmore.name: proximityUUID
Classes/IBeaconDevice.html#/s:9Matchmore.abstract: The UUID of the beacon, the purpose is to distinguish iBeacons in your network, from all other beacons in networks outside your control.

Classes/IBeaconDevice.html#/s:9Matchmore.name: major
Classes/IBeaconDevice.html#/s:9Matchmore.abstract: Major values are intended to identify and distinguish a group.

Classes/IBeaconDevice.html#/s:9Matchmore.name: minor
Classes/IBeaconDevice.html#/s:9Matchmore.abstract: Minor values are intended to identify and distinguish an individual.

Classes/Device.html#/s:9Matchmore6Device.name: createdAt
Classes/Device.html#/s:9Matchmore6Device.abstract: The timestamp of the device’s creation in seconds since Jan 01 1970 (UTC).

Classes/Device.html#/s:9Matchmore6Device.name: updatedAt
Classes/Device.html#/s:9Matchmore6Device.abstract: The timestamp of the device’s creation in seconds since Jan 01 1970 (UTC).

Classes/Device.html#/s:9Matchmore6Device.name: group
Classes/Device.html#/s:9Matchmore6Device.abstract: Optional device groups, one device can belong to multiple groups, grops are string that can be max 25 characters long and contains letters numbers or underscores

Classes/Match.html#/s:9Matchmore5MatchC9.name: createdAt
Classes/Match.html#/s:9Matchmore5MatchC9.abstract: The timestamp of the match in seconds since Jan 01 1970 (UTC).

Classes/Publication.html#/s:9Matchmore11.name: createdAt
Classes/Publication.html#/s:9Matchmore11.abstract: The timestamp of the publication creation in seconds since Jan 01 1970 (UTC).

Classes/Publication.html#/s:9Matchmore11.name: worldId
Classes/Publication.html#/s:9Matchmore11.abstract: The id (UUID) of the world that contains device to attach a publication to.

Classes/Publication.html#/s:9Matchmore11.name: deviceId
Classes/Publication.html#/s:9Matchmore11.abstract: The id (UUID) of the device to attach a publication to.

Classes/Publication.html#/s:9Matchmore11.name: topic
Classes/Publication.html#/s:9Matchmore11.abstract: The topic of the publication. This will act as a first match filter. For a subscription to be able to match a publication they must have the exact same topic.

Classes/Publication.html#/s:9Matchmore11.name: location
Classes/Publication.html#/s:9Matchmore11.abstract: In some cases a develop might want to show the location.

Classes/Publication.html#/s:9Matchmore11.name: range
Classes/Publication.html#/s:9Matchmore11.abstract: The range of the publication in meters. This is the range around the device holding the publication in which matches with subscriptions can be triggered.

Classes/Publication.html#/s:9Matchmore11.name: duration
Classes/Publication.html#/s:9Matchmore11.abstract: The duration of the publication in seconds. If set to ‘0’ it will be instant at the time of publication. Negative values are not allowed.

Classes/Publication.html#/s:9Matchmore11.name: properties
Classes/Publication.html#/s:9Matchmore11.abstract: The dictionary of key, value pairs. Allowed values are number, boolean, string and array of afformentioned types

Classes/Location.html#/s:9Matchmore8Loca.name: createdAt
Classes/Location.html#/s:9Matchmore8Loca.abstract: The timestamp of the location creation in seconds since Jan 01 1970 (UTC).

Classes/Location.html#/s:9Matchmore8Loca.name: latitude
Classes/Location.html#/s:9Matchmore8Loca.abstract: The latitude of the device in degrees, for instance ‘46.5333’ (Lausanne, Switzerland).

Classes/Location.html#/s:9Matchmore8Loca.name: longitude
Classes/Location.html#/s:9Matchmore8Loca.abstract: The longitude of the device in degrees, for instance ‘6.6667’ (Lausanne, Switzerland).

Classes/Location.html#/s:9Matchmore8Loca.name: altitude
Classes/Location.html#/s:9Matchmore8Loca.abstract: The altitude of the device in meters, for instance ‘495.0’ (Lausanne, Switzerland).

Classes/Location.html#/s:9Matchmore8Loca.name: horizontalAccuracy
Classes/Location.html#/s:9Matchmore8Loca.abstract: The horizontal accuracy of the location, measured on a scale from ‘0.0’ to ‘1.0’, ‘1.0’ being the most accurate. If this value is not specified then the default value of ‘1.0’ is used.

Classes/Location.html#/s:9Matchmore8Loca.name: verticalAccuracy
Classes/Location.html#/s:9Matchmore8Loca.abstract: The vertical accuracy of the location, measured on a scale from ‘0.0’ to ‘1.0’, ‘1.0’ being the most accurate. If this value is not specified then the default value of ‘1.0’ is used.

Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.name: configure(_:)
Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.abstract: Configuration method.

Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.name: mainDevice
Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.abstract: Main mobile device created by startUsingMainDevice()

Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.name: publications
Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.abstract: Async store of all created publications.

Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.name: subscriptions
Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.abstract: Async store of all created subscriptions.

Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.name: mobileDevices
Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.abstract: Async store of all create mobile devices

Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.name: pinDevices
Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.abstract: Async store of all create pin devices.

Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.name: knownBeacons
Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.abstract: Async store of all known iBeacon Triples.

Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.name: deviceToken
Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.abstract: Last ANPS token used by SDK.

Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.name: allMatches
Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.abstract: List of all delivered Matches.

Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.name: matchDelegates
Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.abstract: List of all match delivery delegates. The delegate has to conform to AlpsDelegate. Adding new delegate can be achieved either by += or add().

Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.name: startPollingMatches(pollingTimeInterval:)
Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.abstract: Starts polling matches every pollingTimeInterval seconds. All matchDelegates are notified about the change.

Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.name: stopPollingMatches()
Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.abstract: Stop polling matches.

Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.name: refreshMatches()
Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.abstract: Refreshes matches.

Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.name: startListeningForNewMatches()
Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.abstract: Opens socket listening for new matches notifications. All matchDelegates are notified about the change.

Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.name: processPushNotification(pushNotification:)
Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.abstract: Proceses MatchMore’s remote push notification and checks for new matches. All matchDelegates are notified about the change.

Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.name: registerDeviceToken(deviceToken:)
Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.abstract: Saves APNS deviceToken to keychain. Device token can be later used to create APNS notification trigger.

Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.name: startUsingMainDevice(device:shouldStartMonitoring:completion:)
Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.abstract: Creates or reuses cached mobile device object. Mobile device object is used to represent the smartphone.

Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.name: createPinDevice(pinDevice:shouldStartMonitoring:completion:)
Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.abstract: Creates new pin device. Device created this way can be accessed via pin devices store: MatchMore.pinDevices or through callback’s Result.

Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.name: createPublication(publication:forDevice:completion:)
Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.abstract: Creates new publication attached to given device.

Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.name: createPublication(publication:forBeacon:completion:)
Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.abstract: Creates new publication attached to beacon.

Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.name: createPublicationForMainDevice(publication:completion:)
Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.abstract: Creates new publication attached to main device.

Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.name: createSubscription(subscription:forDevice:completion:)
Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.abstract: Creates new subscription attached to device with given id.

Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.name: createSubscriptionForMainDevice(subscription:completion:)
Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.abstract: Creates new subscription attached to device with given id.

Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.name: startMonitoringMatches(forDevice:)
Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.abstract: Start monitoring matches for given device. In order to receive matches implement MatchDelegate.

Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.name: stopMonitoringMatches(forDevice:)
Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.abstract: Stop monitoring matches for given device. In order to receive matches implement MatchDelegate.

Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.name: lastLocation
Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.abstract: Last location gathered by SDK.

Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.name: startUpdatingLocation()
Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.abstract: Starts location updating and sending to MatchMore’s cloud.

Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.name: stopUpdatingLocation()
Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.abstract: Stops location updating and sending to MatchMore’s cloud.

Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.name: refreshKnownBeacons()
Classes/MatchMore.html#/s:9Matchmore9Mat.abstract: Forces refreshing known iBecaon devices from MatchMore cloud.

Classes/DeviceAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore9Dev.name: createLocation(deviceId:location:completion:)
Classes/DeviceAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore9Dev.abstract: Create a new location for a device

Classes/DeviceAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore9Dev.name: createLocationWithRequestBuilder(deviceId:location:)
Classes/DeviceAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore9Dev.abstract: Create a new location for a device

Classes/DeviceAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore9Dev.name: getIBeaconTriples(completion:)
Classes/DeviceAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore9Dev.abstract: Get IBeacons triples for all registered devices

Classes/DeviceAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore9Dev.name: getIBeaconTriplesWithRequestBuilder()
Classes/DeviceAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore9Dev.abstract: Get IBeacons triples for all registered devices

Classes/DeviceAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore9Dev.name: getMatch(deviceId:matchId:completion:)
Classes/DeviceAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore9Dev.abstract: Get match for the device by its id

Classes/DeviceAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore9Dev.name: getMatchWithRequestBuilder(deviceId:matchId:)
Classes/DeviceAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore9Dev.abstract: Get match for the device by its id

Classes/DeviceAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore9Dev.name: getPublication(deviceId:publicationId:completion:)
Classes/DeviceAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore9Dev.abstract: Info about a publication on a device

Classes/DeviceAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore9Dev.name: getPublicationWithRequestBuilder(deviceId:publicationId:)
Classes/DeviceAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore9Dev.abstract: Info about a publication on a device

Classes/DeviceAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore9Dev.name: getSubscription(deviceId:subscriptionId:completion:)
Classes/DeviceAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore9Dev.abstract: Info about a subscription on a device

Classes/DeviceAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore9Dev.name: getSubscriptionWithRequestBuilder(deviceId:subscriptionId:)
Classes/DeviceAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore9Dev.abstract: Info about a subscription on a device

Classes/DeviceAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore9Dev.name: triggerProximityEvents(deviceId:proximityEvent:completion:)
Classes/DeviceAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore9Dev.abstract: Trigger the proximity event between a device and a ranged BLE iBeacon

Classes/DeviceAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore9Dev.name: triggerProximityEventsWithRequestBuilder(deviceId:proximityEvent:)
Classes/DeviceAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore9Dev.abstract: Trigger the proximity event between a device and a ranged BLE iBeacon

Classes/DeviceAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore9Dev.name: updateDevice(deviceId:device:completion:)
Classes/DeviceAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore9Dev.abstract: Updates name or/and device token for existing device

Classes/DeviceAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore9Dev.name: updateDeviceWithRequestBuilder(deviceId:device:)
Classes/DeviceAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore9Dev.abstract: Updates name or/and device token for existing device

Classes/MatchesAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore10M.name: getMatch(deviceId:matchId:completion:)
Classes/MatchesAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore10M.abstract: Get match for the device by its id

Classes/MatchesAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore10M.name: getMatchWithRequestBuilder(deviceId:matchId:)
Classes/MatchesAPI.html#/s:9Matchmore10M.abstract: Get match for the device by its id

Classes/Subscription.html#/s:9Matchmore1.name: createdAt
Classes/Subscription.html#/s:9Matchmore1.abstract: The timestamp of the subscription creation in seconds since Jan 01 1970 (UTC).

Classes/Subscription.html#/s:9Matchmore1.name: worldId
Classes/Subscription.html#/s:9Matchmore1.abstract: The id (UUID) of the world that contains device to attach a subscription to.

Classes/Subscription.html#/s:9Matchmore1.name: deviceId
Classes/Subscription.html#/s:9Matchmore1.abstract: The id (UUID) of the device to attach a subscription to.

Classes/Subscription.html#/s:9Matchmore1.name: topic
Classes/Subscription.html#/s:9Matchmore1.abstract: The topic of the subscription. This will act as a first match filter. For a subscription to be able to match a publication they must have the exact same topic.

Classes/Subscription.html#/s:9Matchmore1.name: location
Classes/Subscription.html#/s:9Matchmore1.abstract: In some cases a develop might want to show the location.

Classes/Subscription.html#/s:9Matchmore1.name: selector
Classes/Subscription.html#/s:9Matchmore1.abstract: This is an expression to filter the publications. For instance ‘job='developer’‘ will allow matching only with publications containing a 'job’ key with a value of ‘developer’.

Classes/Subscription.html#/s:9Matchmore1.name: range
Classes/Subscription.html#/s:9Matchmore1.abstract: The range of the subscription in meters. This is the range around the device holding the subscription in which matches with publications can be triggered.

Classes/Subscription.html#/s:9Matchmore1.name: duration
Classes/Subscription.html#/s:9Matchmore1.abstract: The duration of the subscription in seconds. If set to ‘0’ it will be instant at the time of subscription. Negative values are not allowed.

Classes/Subscription.html#/s:9Matchmore1.name: matchTTL
Classes/Subscription.html#/s:9Matchmore1.abstract: The duration of the match in seconds, this describes how often you will get matches when publication and subscription are moving in each other range. If set to ‘0’ you will get matches every time publication or subscription in range will move. Negative values are not allowed.

Classes/Subscription.html#/s:9Matchmore1.name: pushers
Classes/Subscription.html#/s:9Matchmore1.abstract: When match will occurs, they will be notified on these provided URI(s) address(es) in the pushers array.

Classes/ProximityEvent.html#/s:9Matchmor.name: createdAt
Classes/ProximityEvent.html#/s:9Matchmor.abstract: The timestamp of the proximity event in seconds since Jan 01 1970 (UTC).

Classes/ProximityEvent.html#/s:9Matchmor.name: deviceId
Classes/ProximityEvent.html#/s:9Matchmor.abstract: The id (UUID) of the iBeacon to trigger a proximity event to.

Classes/ProximityEvent.html#/s:9Matchmor.name: distance
Classes/ProximityEvent.html#/s:9Matchmor.abstract: Distance between the mobile device that trigger the proximity event and the ranged iBeacon. This distance is automatically generated by the SDK based upon the CLProximity.

Classes/DeviceUpdate.html#/s:9Matchmore1.name: deviceToken
Classes/DeviceUpdate.html#/s:9Matchmore1.abstract: Token used for pushing matches. The token needs to be prefixed with `apns://` or `fcm://` dependent on the device or channel the match should be pushed with

Classes/DeviceUpdate.html.name: DeviceUpdate
Classes/DeviceUpdate.html.abstract: Describes update of device, it allows to change name of device and device token (only in case of mobile devices)

Classes/ProximityEvent.html.name: ProximityEvent
Classes/ProximityEvent.html.abstract: A proximity event is triggered to the core when a mobile device detects an iBeacon device in his Bluetooth Low Energy(BLE) range.

Classes/Subscription.html.name: Subscription
Classes/Subscription.html.abstract: A subscription can be seen as a JMS subscription extended with the notion of geographical zone. The zone again being defined as circle with a center at the given location and a range around that location.

Classes/PinDevice.html.name: PinDevice
Classes/PinDevice.html.abstract: A pin device is one that has geographical location associated with it but is not represented by any object in the physical world.

Classes/MatchMore.html.name: MatchMore
Classes/MatchMore.html.abstract: MatchMore is a static facade for all public methods and properties available in the SDK.

Classes/Publication.html.name: Publication
Classes/Publication.html.abstract: A publication can be seen as a JavaMessagingService (JMS) publication extended with the notion of a geographical zone. The zone is defined as circle with a center at the given location and a range around that location.

Classes/Match.html.name: Match
Classes/Match.html.abstract: An object representing a match between a subscription and a publication.

Classes/Device.html.name: Device
Classes/Device.html.abstract: A device might be either virtual like a pin device or physical like a mobile phone or iBeacon device.

Classes/IBeaconDevice.html.name: IBeaconDevice
Classes/IBeaconDevice.html.abstract: An iBeacon device represents an Apple conform iBeacon announcing its presence via Bluetooth advertising packets.

Classes/MobileDevice.html.name: MobileDevice
Classes/MobileDevice.html.abstract: A mobile device is one that potentially moves together with its user and therefore has a geographical location associated with it.

Typealiases.html.name: Type Aliases
Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
